text.p: These are the leading stories in the Zambian press on Tuesday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- The new owners of the previously state-run Kaforindi Explosives close its outdated nitroglycerine plant to construct a new one. The new owners, ICI Explosives Africa, plans to lay off about 100 workers.
- A strike by council workers in the northern Copperbelt Province enters its fifth day on Monday.
- France has reaffirmed its support for the Southern African Development Community (SADC) which it considers a viable instrument for development.
- The Zambia Congress of Trade Unions says government has no right to audit its books because it does not fund the unions.
- Editor of the independent Chronicle newspaper Lweendo Hamusankwa has been charged with criminally libelling an aide of President Frederick Chiluba.
- Portuguese and Zambian businessmen are to launch a Portguese-Zambian commercial and industrial association in March this year.
